meanings.definition: To bring peace, quiet, or calm to; soothe
meanings.sent1: She was appeasing her crying baby by gently rocking him to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The music was appeasing her nerves before the big presentation.
meanings.sent3: The cat was appeasing the noisy dog by sharing its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The warm cup of tea was appeasing her worries like a comforting hug.
meanings.sent5: The soft, soothing voice of the storyteller was appeasing the children's fears.

meanings.sent1: Eating a piece of chocolate was appeasing her sweet tooth.
meanings.sent2: The apology was appeasing his hurt feelings.
meanings.sent3: The warm blanket was appeasing her shivers on the cold night.
meanings.sent4: The kind words were appeasing her doubts like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The cool water was appeasing his thirst after a long run.

meanings.definition: To make concessions to (someone, such as an aggressor or a critic) in order to avoid conflict
meanings.sent1: The leader was appeasing the rival group by offering a compromise.
meanings.sent2: She was appeasing her boss by agreeing to work overtime.
meanings.sent3: The child was appeasing his sibling by sharing his favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The diplomat was appeasing the opposing country with a peace treaty.
meanings.sent5: The student was appeasing the strict teacher by completing all assignments on time.
